36/**
37 * \file
38 *
39 * This file contains functions to read and write the cache(s)
40 * to text format.
41 *
42 * The format of the file is as follows:
43 * [RRset cache]
44 * [Message cache]
45 * EOF -- fixed string "EOF" before end of the file.
46 *
47 * The RRset cache is:
48 * START_RRSET_CACHE
49 * [rrset]*
50 * END_RRSET_CACHE
51 *
52 * rrset is:
53 * ;rrset [nsec_apex] TTL rr_count rrsig_count trust security
54 * resource records, one per line, in zonefile format
55 * rrsig records, one per line, in zonefile format
56 * If the text conversion fails, BADRR is printed on the line.
57 *
58 * The Message cache is:
59 * START_MSG_CACHE
60 * [msg]*
61 * END_MSG_CACHE
62 *
63 * msg is:
64 * msg name class type flags qdcount ttl security an ns ar
65 * list of rrset references, one per line. If conversion fails, BADREF
66 * reference is:
67 * name class type flags
68 *
69 * Expired cache entries are not printed.
70 */
71
72#ifndef DAEMON_DUMPCACHE_H
73#define DAEMON_DUMPCACHE_H
74struct worker;
75#include "daemon/remote.h"
76
77/**
78 * Dump cache(s) to text
79 * @param ssl: to print to
80 * @param worker: worker that is available (buffers, etc) and has
81 * ptrs to the caches.
82 * @return false on ssl print error.
83 */
84int dump_cache(RES* ssl, struct worker* worker);
85
86/**
87 * Load cache(s) from text
88 * @param ssl: to read from
89 * @param worker: worker that is available (buffers, etc) and has
90 * ptrs to the caches.
91 * @return false on ssl error.
92 */
93int load_cache(RES* ssl, struct worker* worker);
94
95/**
96 * Print the delegation used to lookup for this name.
97 * @param ssl: to read from
98 * @param worker: worker that is available (buffers, etc) and has
99 * ptrs to the caches.
100 * @param nm: name to lookup
101 * @param nmlen: length of name.
102 * @param nmlabs: labels in name.
103 * @return false on ssl error.
104 */
105int print_deleg_lookup(RES* ssl, struct worker* worker, uint8_t* nm,
106 size_t nmlen, int nmlabs);
107
108#endif /* DAEMON_DUMPCACHE_H */
109
